Class CompetitorList

java.lang.Object
CompetitorList
public class CompetitorList extends Object
This class uses the concept of ArrayList.

The CompetitorList class represents the ArrayList used for storing data about competitors. This class is a modified version of ArrayList with custom variables and methods to meet the specification.

This class includes methods to read a CSV file, generate a final report, support methods to generate the report, write data to an external text file and support methods for GUI.

F21SF Software Engineering Foundations - Assignment 2

Author:
Kawthar Mohammad Adam (km2065)

  • Method Details

    • getSize

      private int getSize()
      Returns the size of the competitorList.
      Returns:
      The size of the competitorList.

    • getTableOfCompetitors

      public String getTableOfCompetitors()
      Returns a string as a table with details of all competitors in the competitorList.
      Returns:
      The table of competitors.

    • findByComNum

      public KMACompetitor findByComNum(int comNum)
      Searches the competitorList to find the competitor using the competitor number. If the competitor number is found then the KMACompetitor is returned. If the competitor number is not found then null is returned since it means that the competitor does not exist.
      Parameters:
      comNum - The unique competitor number to identify competitors.
      Returns:
      The object KMACompetitor if the competitor is found, null otherwise.

    • getHighestScoreDetails

      private String getHighestScoreDetails()
      Compares the overall score of all competitors and stores the highest score and competitor number for further checks. It then checks if there is a tie between 2 or more competitors using the highest score and the competitor number. Returns a string containing the full details of all competitors if there are 2 or more winners, otherwise the full details of only one competitor.
      Returns:
      The full details of the winner(s).

    • getFrequencyTable

      private String getFrequencyTable()
      Generates the frequency table of scores ranging from 1 to 5. Returns the formatted string as a table containing scores and their frequency.
      Returns:
      The frequency table of scores.

    • getAverage

      private double getAverage()
      Calculates the average of overall scores for all competitors in the competitorList and returns the average value.
      Returns:
      The average of overall scores.

    • getMax

      private double getMax()
      Determines the value of the highest overall score and returns it.
      Returns:
      The maximum overall score.

    • getMin

      private double getMin()
      Determines the value of the lowest overall score and returns it.
      Returns:
      The minimum overall score.

    • getSummaryStats

      private String getSummaryStats()
      Creates a summary table with average, maximum and minimum values.
      Returns:
      The summary table.

    • generateFinalReport

      public String generateFinalReport()
      Generates two types of reports. The report not required can be commented out.

      First report: Contains the table of competitors, full details of winners, frequency table and summary table (this report is commented out).

      Second report: Contains short details of all competitors and full details of winners.

      Returns:
      The final report.

    • addOneCompetitor

      public boolean addOneCompetitor(KMACompetitor c)
      Adds the new competitor to the competitorList by checking whether it exists already in the list. If the competitor number of the competitor does not exist, then the competitor will be added to the competitorList, otherwise, it will return false.
      Parameters:
      c - The KMACompetitor object that needs to be added to the competitorList.
      Returns:
      true if the competitor does not exist already, otherwise false.

    • readFile

      public void readFile(String fileName)
      Reads data from the CSV file line-by-line. Lines are processed if they are not empty, otherwise, they are ignored.

      An error message is displayed and the system exits normally if the file is not found.

      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the file that needs to be read.

    • writeToFile

      public void writeToFile(String fileName, String report)
      Writes data to a text file.

      The stack trace will be printed and the system will exit urgently if an exception occurs.

      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the file to which the data will be written to.
      report - The string that needs to be written to the file.

    • processLine

      private void processLine(String line, String fileName)
      Processes the data being read from the CSV file line-by-line. It splits the line into parts when it finds a ',' and stores the string into an array. It then converts the data in the array to the required data type so that it can be used when creating a competitor.

      If the competitor is a cyclo-cross cyclist, then the years of experience should be between 10 and 50 years.

      The scores at the end of the line are stored in a string array, converted to an integer, checked to ensure the values are between 1-5 and then added to the final integer array.

      The competitor is added to the competitorList if it does not exist already.

      The fileName is checked to find out whether the object will be created for RoadCyclist, TrackCyclist or CycloCrossCyclist.

      Error messages are displayed if the expected data type is not entered (ex: age is entered as 'Twenty' instead of 20), if the cyclo-cross cyclists don't have an experience of 10 to 50 years, if the values for the competitor are missing, if the fileName does not match and if the comLevel for CycloCross is not 'Expert'.

      Parameters:
      line - The line read by the scanner from the .txt file.
      fileName - The name of the file which is being read.

    • listByNum

      public String listByNum()
      Sorts the KMACompetitor objects by competitor number
      Returns:
      Table of competitors sorted by competitor number

    • listByName

      public String listByName()
      Sorts the KMACompetitor objects by name.
      Returns:
      Table of competitors sorted by name.

    • listByScore

      public String listByScore()
      Sorts the KMACompetitor objects by overall score.
      Returns:
      Table of competitors sorted by overall score.

    • filterBeginner

      public ArrayList<KMACompetitor> filterBeginner()
      Filters the competitorList on the comLevel "Beginner" and adds those objects to a new ArrayList.
      Returns:
      The filtered ArrayList.

    • filterIntermediate

      public ArrayList<KMACompetitor> filterIntermediate()
      Filters the competitorList on the comLevel "Intermediate" and adds those objects to a new ArrayList.
      Returns:
      The filtered ArrayList.

    • filterExpert

      public ArrayList<KMACompetitor> filterExpert()
      Filters the competitorList on the comLevel "Expert" and adds those objects to a new ArrayList.
      Returns:
      The filtered ArrayList.

    • addAll

      public ArrayList<KMACompetitor> addAll(ArrayList<KMACompetitor> c1, ArrayList<KMACompetitor> c2, ArrayList<KMACompetitor> c3)
      Appends 3 ArrayLists into one.
      Parameters:
      c1 - The first ArrayList for merging.
      c2 - The second ArrayList for merging.
      c3 - The third ArrayList for merging.
      Returns:
      The final ArrayList.
